title: Field Practicum and Social Inclusion System Design Course for Pre-Elementary Teachers' Self-Efficacy Enhancement

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of basic concepts and intermediate-level application skills. Requires foundational understanding of social interaction and educational systems
context.additional_context: Blended learning program combining VR-based virtual classroom simulations with field-linked projects. Includes activities to foster cultural sensitivity and civic consciousness.

learning_goals: Learners perform VR simulation scenarios supporting students with special educational needs with over 80% success rate, incorporating elements of social relationship building and cultural diversity considerations.

Through reflective journaling based on field practicum experiences, learners demonstrate a 20% or higher improvement in self-efficacy metrics and strengthen their awareness of roles as educators and citizens.

Learners apply principles of complex adaptive systems (feedback loops, self-organization, etc.) to complete an inclusive lesson design project (selecting 1 topic from 5 options) in teams of 3–4, achieving over 80 points based on an evaluation rubric (creativity 25%, applicability 35%, completeness 40%). The project includes community resource integration and institutional support strategies.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
